Tools¶

decitala.tools.augment(fragment, factor=1.0, difference=0.0)¶

Returns an augmentation in the style of Messiaen. If difference is set to 0, then the augmentation is multiplicative. If factor is set to 1, then augmentation is additive. If factor & difference are non-zero, we have a mixed augmentation.

Parameters

  • fragment (numpy.array) – array defining the rhythmic fragment.

  • factor (float) – factor for multiplicative augmentation

  • difference (float) – factor for additive augmentation

>>> augment(fragment=[1.0, 1.0, 0.5, 0.25], factor=2.0, difference=0.25)
array([2.25, 2.25, 1.25, 0.75])
